metadata.titel_preek: Night of Shame, Night of Glory

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the agony in Gethsemane, the nature of crucifixion as shaming, and the theological meaning of Christ taking on God's judgment for sin.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong focus on the Greek nuances of 'agony' and the social-historical context of Roman crucifixion.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the reality of the atonement, but shifts into promising and declaring the hearer's freedom toward the end.
voorbeelden: God has condemned sin in the flesh of Jesus and we are free.
This cup which is poured out for you is the new covenant in my blood.
To know sin is to be already in a state of grace.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Gratitude, relief from condemnation, and communal love.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The Spirit is mentioned as the 'motive power' behind gratitude, but not explicitly invoked as the agent of the word.

voorbeelden: Jesus was the one truly perfect human being.
Sin is a very unfashionable topic.
The Greek is very strong here.
Listen carefully to this great truth.
Think about the words as you sing them.
Let us turn our attention to what occurs immediately after.
I do not think it is wrong for you to think of yourselves as the inner circle.
I remember reading a book...
I love to confess my sins!
He is preparing, tonight, to give us all the vitamins tomorrow.
The victory is given to us as a present.
He will show you in his own time.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong. The preacher successfully binds God's future action to the hearer's present reality.

voorbeelden: God has condemned sin in the flesh of Jesus and we are free.
There is therefore now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus.
To know sin is to be already in a state of grace.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High. The preacher speaks as a mandatory of the Gospel, declaring a new status for the congregation.

indicatoren: Lengthy discussion of Bible study group insights.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer receives excellent information but may feel like an observer of a lecture for the first half of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Direct absolution (I forgive you) is replaced by a general declaration (We are free).
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is addressed, but the 'event' happens late in the text.

voorbeelden: The Son of God declares himself ready to lay down his life for you.
The victory is given to us as a present.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and inclusive 'we' to build community.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Directly addressing the 'inner circle' of the congregation.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the benefits of the cross: 'for you'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Jesus, the disciples, and the nature of sin.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a historical-theological distance that is only bridged in the final third.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Tonight' of the liturgy and the present freedom of the hearer.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Avoids moralism; the imperatives are minimal and grounded in the indicative.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the Agony (Assertive) to the Ransom (Declarative) to the response of Gratitude (Directive/Expressive).
voorbeelden: God has condemned sin... and we are free. Our response is gratitude.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent. The 'Toezegging' (Promise) is the pivot point.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: The victory is given to us... as an act of grateful worship... we are now going to sing.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon successfully moves beyond 'talking about' the cross to 'bestowing' the benefits of the cross upon the listeners.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: God has condemned sin in the flesh of Jesus and we are free.
sterke_punten.effect: Changes the hearer's status from guilty to liberated.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The discussion of the Bible study group and the vitamin pills.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Takes up significant space before the performative address begins.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it transitions from 'What happened then' to 'What is happening to you now'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of 'Tonight' and the connection to the Eucharist makes the word an extension of the sacrament.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, the preacher uses the 'new covenant' words as a present address.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, the preacher assumes the authority to declare the congregation 'free'.
tekstueel_bewijs: This is the supreme night of love, this night in which the Son of God declares himself ready to lay down his life for you.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly, as the source of gratitude.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the preacher leaves the 'how' of self-giving to God's timing.
tekstueel_bewijs: Don't worry about how you are going to give yourself to him; he will show you in his own time.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Strongly present; the sermon prepares for and interprets the 'Body and Blood'.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, especially in the description of the 'Night'.
tekstueel_bewijs: We are shortly going to participate in his Body and Blood, the pledge of his eternal life given to us.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is/was' (Assertive) but finishes with strong 'are/give' (Declarative/Commissive).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Son of God is going to receive in his own body the condemnation of God against Sin.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Tonight, Christ receives in his own body the condemnation that was meant for you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a future/historical description to a present/performative event.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Maintain the current strength of the 'we are free' declaration.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because He was bound, you are free.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The first half relies heavily on 'I remember' and 'The group said'.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Integrate the 'you' earlier in the exegetical section.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, like the disciples, may feel that foreboding tonight.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: The balance is already homiletically sound.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of how to move from historical exegesis to sacramental proclamation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (the vitamin pill story), SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the word to change the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the pathos of the crucifixion description, but in the illocutionary force of the promise: 'God has condemned sin... and we are free.'
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's climax is not the information about Gethsemane, but the Commissive act where Christ's victory is 'given as a present'.

declaratief: are in a state of grace

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God has condemned sin in the flesh of Jesus and we are free.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: This is the 'event' of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'inner circle' metaphor to establish a felicity condition for the performative acts that follow.
